intro: Scorodonia betonicifolia, commonly known as the lesser betony, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic and medicinal plants. The plant has finely divided, fern-like leaves and produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels. Scorodonia betonicifolia is valued for its historical use in herbal medicine and its ornamental appeal in gardens.
